column5: message
Add a link to Bo's article on factories to the README.
Update the status to reflect the lack of development.

Bring dependencies up to current versions.

This involved taking out rcov, as it isn't happy on Ruby 1.9 and later.
Cleaning up rogue spaces.
README updates.
Bump version to 2.0.
Updated to use newer RDoc.
Update some dependencies.
Updated to the README.
Took out unnecessary require of active_support.

Run rcov by default.

I want to maintain 100% coverage, so better to have this run every time than do it as an afterthought.

Get rid of the serial_number alias for sn.

serial_number is not an uncommon name for an attribute on a model, so better not to use it.
Aaannnddd more README tweaks.
More README improvements.
Slowly getting the docs in place.
Ignore my .rvmrc, and clean up .gitignore.
Working on the README.

Merge pull request #83 from sobrinho/master

Object caching was removed, cleanup the generators.
Encourage the use of Machinist 2.

Get rid of all the "should"s from spec names.

Old, bad habit.
Fix unnecessary call to make! in a blueprint.
Removed dependency on old RSpec beta version.
`Machinist.reset_before_test` was removed in 2839888
Use `cucumber?` on install generator to be consistent with `rspec?`
Removed Machinist::Warehouse - left over from 2839888.
Moved gem configuration from the Gemfile to the gemspec, as per the `bundle gem` design.
Removed jeweler.
New gemspec, gemerated by `bundle gem`.
Change the namespace of RSpec from Rspec to RSpec.
Pulled caching out of the ActiveRecord adapter.
Brutally ripped out all the caching code.
Fixed a typo.

Changed "Issue tracker" to "Bug tracker".

People have been making general support requests in the issue tracker.
Hopefully this will clarify what it's for.
Added a link back to Machinist 1 to the readme.

Belatedly added Ben H and Xavier to contributors.

They had a huge influence on the design of the caching model. The Shop,
which is probably my favourite bit of code in here, exists largely
thanks to them.
README had a link to the old machinist2 branch.
Released 2.0.0.beta2.
Added a way to disable object caching.

Merge branch 'machinist2'

Time to chuck out the old master, and switch to Machinist 2! Yay!

Machinist 1.0 is now on the 1.0-maintenance branch.
Machinist 2.0.0beta1 release.

Added Jeremy Durham to contributors.

He wrote a patch to do serial numbers in blueprints for Machinist 1. It
never got included, but the idea lives on in Machinist 2.
Documentation.
Doc tweaks.

Removed Lathe#finalised_object.

It's only needed on the strategies branch, so it should live there.
Cleaned up method naming and lathe errors.
Better exceptions.
Improved the shop specs.
Naming improvements in the shop.
Tweaked the gitignore.
Documentation.
And a little more cleaning up.
Cleaned up the generators a bit.

Rails 3 generators for Test::Unit and Cucumber.

I haven't tested this well. YMMV.
Moved more documentation to the wiki.
Moved more stuff from the README to the wiki.
Added Rails 2 installation instructions.
Can it be? Another FIXME.
More doc improvements.
Continuing adding docs.
Fixed requires in machinist.rb.
More prep for implementing strategies.
Slight speedup in generating serial numbers.
Docs for warehouse.

Moved some stuff from Blueprint to Lathe.

The Lathe is now responsible for creating the object being contructed.
This will make it easier to implement different construction strategies.
Cleaned up the inheritance code a bit.
A little comment.
Added yet another FIXME. Woo hoo!
Blueprints now follow class inheritance.
Renamed the README file, for aesthetic reasons.
Cleaned up the Shop API a little.
Rakefile cleanups.
Rdoc for the shop.
Started in on writing rdoc.
Naming improvements.
Added the MIT license back in.
Cleaned up badly named methods in Machinable.
Working my way through documenting everything.
Keeping coverage at 100%.
Handle id and type attributes in blueprints.

Took out collections for now.

I haven't yet figured out how to make it good enough.
Added Rails 3 generators.
More documentation scribblings.
Use bundler to resolve dependencies for testing.

First cut at collections.

This is experimental. The syntax still feels ambiguous, and the
complexity of the Machinist::Collection::Lathe class backs up that
feeling.
Naming and README tweaks.
Took out an unused line. Clean code is good code.
Added a few more FIXMEs. Can't have enough!
Took out the unused spec/log directory.
Habtm support. Trying simpler association logic.
Started taking notes for the README.

Improvements to ActiveRecord associations.

The auto-generation stuff would always run, even if you provided a block
for an association attribute. Now the block takes precedence.
ActiveRecord association support. Bewdiful.

Got rid of adapters.

All the magic now lives in the blueprint class, which simplifies things
nicely.
Cleaned up ActiveRecord related specs.

Experimenting with make! for make and save.

Adapters now let you define specific Lathe and Blueprint subclasses.
That should make it easier to start re-implementing that ActiveRecord
specific stuff, like automatic handling of associations.

Making make less smart about saving should, in theory, let you do more
smart stuff with ActiveRecord associations, because it'll let you have
control over save order. That's the theory anyway.

The next bit ot add is collections: a way to make a bunch of associated
objects in one hit, and get references back for all of them. I've got an
idea how this work, and most of the infrastructure I think I need is
there now.

Lots of new hotness!

This will make an array of 3 posts:
    Post.make(3)

This will make a post for the post attribute:
    Comment.blueprint do
      post
    end

This will make an array of 3 comments for the comments attribute:
    Post.blueprint do
      comments 3
    end
Minor cleanups.
Hacked rcov to work and completed coverage.
Made "require 'machinist'" work.
Made Machinable use the shop.
Renamed Mixin to Machinable.

Added named blueprint support.

Named blueprints for a class have to be defined after the master
blueprint if you want inheritance to work.

Added initial mixin support.

Finally we can call Post.blueprint and Post.make again! Woot!
Added blueprint inheritance.
Added serial number support.
Spec for shop caching multiple objects.
Added initial shop support.
Pulled in warehouse and specs.
100% coverage.
Blueprint and Lathe classes, plus specs.
Fixed install docs to match the latest Rails.

Added development dependencies for ActiveRecord, DataMapper, etc.

Closes #21.
Merge branch 'better_error'

All specs now use block syntax in blueprints.

Soon I'm going to deprecate doing this:

  Post.blueprint do
    title "Test"
  end

in favour of:

  Post.blueprint do
    title { "Test" }
  end

The former was creating confusion and getting people into trouble. Also,
reserving the argument to an attribute method in a blueprint opens up
some other possibilites, e.g. "author_name :name" instead of
"author_name { Sham.name }"

Merge branch 'master' into better_error

Conflicts:
	lib/machinist.rb
	spec/machinist_spec.rb

raise exception when calling make with undefined named blueprint

Conflicts:

	spec/machinist_spec.rb
Fixed Sequel specs to work with autospec.
Regenerated gemspec for version 1.0.6
Version bump to 1.0.6
Use Jeweler for building the gem.
Version bump to 0.0.0
Version bump to 0.0.0.1.0.5
Fixed deprecation warnings in DataMapper specs.

Handle named blueprints without a master better.

This raises a more descriptive error, and mentions the need for a master
blueprint in the docs.

Note that the docs refer to a master blueprint as a "default blueprint".
I should unify this language.

Fixed bug in example code for Sham in the README.

Thanks to David Vrensk (http://github.com/dvrensk) for pointing out the
problem.

Bumped gem version to 1.0.5 for Sequel support.

Big thanks to Pavel Kunc and Roland Swingler. I should have merged
these changes ages ago!
Merge remote branch 'pk/master'

Test for assignment to has_many associations.

Based on adzap's patch, hence he gets the authorship of this one.
Took out yet another unintended ActiveSupport dependency.

Allow assignment to has_many associations.

Idea courtesy Jeremy Durham. There's a can of worms here, but let's open
it and see what happens.
Merge branch 'master' of git://github.com/notahat/machinist
Release 1.0.4, now on gemcutter.

Removed use of "returning".

This was a leftover from the previous requirement for ActiveSupport.
Removed requirement for ActiveRecord from Sham.
Merge branch 'master' of git://github.com/notahat/machinist
Small fix for sequel specs.
Made sure ActiveRecord#make works even if machinist/object isn't loaded.
allow a named blueprint to called through from association method in blueprint

Cleaned up inheritance support.

This is my improvements on Rubysolo's patches to make Machinist look at
superclasses when evaluating blueprints. The order of blueprint
evaluation is now: name blueprint, this class's blueprint, parent
class's blueprint, etc.
add inheritance tests to DM spec
make blueprints be natively inheritance-aware.
whitespace changes
add find_or_make convenience method
subclass blueprints should not stomp on superclass blueprints
add STI support for active record.

Test for calling make on a class with no blueprint

Calling make on a class with no blueprint should raise an exception, and
a few submitted patches break this behaviour.
Merged with knaveofdiamonds/master
Added support for Sequel.
Load active record in the adapter only. When is needed.
Ignore VIM project plugin files.
Added Lawrence Pit to the contributors list.
before(:each) instead of before(:before) of course
Adding a sequel adapter. As Sequel follows a different model to ActiveRecord, make_unsaved won't work for object graphs, and you can't call make on an association (i.e. post.comments.make).
Bump gem version.
bump gem version
Sham.reset(:all) + Sham.reset(:before)
Documentation fix.
Final documentation tweaks for 1.0.
Bumped gem version to 1.0.0.
Updated the list of contributors.
Added missing spec for handling DM validations.
Added spec for uncovered code in the DM adapter.
Patch from hassox: support for edge version of DM.
Added DataMapper code to the gemspec.
DataMapper adapter plan method.

Added make_unsaved for DataMapper.

The with_save_nerfed and nerfed? methods now live in the Machinist
module, rather than in the ActiveRecord adapter.
DataMapper spec cleanup.
Use in-memory sqlite DB for ActiveRecord tests.

Active record association extensions fixed.

They were on belongs_to when they should have been on has_many. The code
still worked, which would suggest that it doesn't need to be there at
all, but it only worked thanks to some freaky undocumented behavious of
associations.

This takes the code coverage back to 100% too, which is always nice.

Basic DataMapper support with tests.

Still to do: make_unsaved, plan, make, methods on associations.

Does DataMapper have protected attributes?

Fixed bug with assign_attribute being called twice.

This was somehow causing a stack overflow when generating assocations in
DataMapper.

Fixed incorrect named blueprints test.

The test wrongly depended on the order of the returned array.

Added basic DataMapper support courtesy hassox.

This is adapted from his fork. It still needs tests, and probably make_unsaved support, etc.

Removed ActiveSupport dependency.

I was no longer using anything out of it anyway.

Bumped gem version to 0.9.0.

This is the beta in preparation for a 1.0 release.

Cleaned up the docs.

Added a description of the Ruby object support. Now recommend requiring 'machinist/active_record' or 'machinist/object' rather than just 'machinist'.
Merge branch 'docs'
Added new files to the gemspec while I remember.

Added plain old Ruby object support.

The specs are now split into core tests (using plain old Ruby objects), and ActiveRecord tests.
Got a few more steps down the road of splitting out the ActiveRecord-specific code.
Refactored code to make Lathe easier to understand.
Started cleaning up the README.
Fixed a failing spec for named_blueprints that wrongly depended on the order of the returned results.
Slight version bump so my gem rebuilds.
Refactor the last commit slightly.

named_blueprints method which returns an array of the named blueprints available to a model.

Also cleaned up the specs by resetting the blueprints after each run. This caught out one test which wasn't de-coupled.
fix spec for plan on has_many assoc not creating extra parent object
Tweaked install instructions for the gem version.
Only undef methods that exist (Ruby 1.9 compatibility)
Fixed a bug in the spec for named blueprints. (Thanks Jonas Nicklas and John Barton.)
Fixed documentation errors.
Bumped the gem version to 0.3.0, after adding named blueprints and automatic use of Sham for attributes.
Added support for named blueprints (after many, many requests.)

If, in a blueprint, you don't provide a block for an attribute, Machinist will default to trying to find a Sham definition with the same name as an attribute.

Whereas before there'd be a lot of this sort of thing:

    Post.blueprint do
      title { Sham.title }
      body  { Sham.body }
    end

you can now shorten this to:

    Post.blueprint do
      title
      body
    end
Bumped gem version to 0.2.2 after a number of people pointed out the 0.2.1 gem didn't include needed files. D'oh!
Bumped the gem version to 0.2.1.
Cleaned up a few things, including adding an FAQ to the readme.

Started moving ActiveRecord-specific code into a separate .rb file, with the intention of supporting other ORM layers.

There are still a couple of places where Lathe introspects on ActiveRecord associations. I still need to work out how to handle those.
Added info on the installing as a gem to the readme, and bumped the version to 0.2.0.

Added documentation on the plan method, and using it for Rails controller tests. Also updated the documentation to cover T.J. Sheehy's patch that introspects on associations to find the class when creating associated objects.
Cleaned up the interface for calling Lathe.

Added support for calling make and plan on ActiveRecord associations.

No documentation yet.
Converted specs to use real ActiveRecord objects and a sqlite database, and picked up a couple of bugs in the tests along the way.
Merge branch 'master' of git://github.com/tjsheehy/machinist

Added the plan method, that parallels make but, rather than saving the object, returns a hash of its attributes. This is great for use in controller tests.

No documentation yet.
Added Ian White to the list of contributors.

Added code to support the :class_name attribute on object associations.

class Comment < ActiveRecord::Base
  belongs_to :author, :class_name => "Person"
end

Previously, machinist would assume that the class name of :author is "Author".
So the blueprint had to explicitly make a "Person":

Comment.blueprint do
  author { Person.make }
end

This change looks at the associated object's class_name so that we can say:

Comment.blueprint do
  author
end
Vastly simplified internals of Sham.define (slaps forehead)
Gem version 0.1.7
Cleaned up Ian White's Sham.define patch.
Use the metaclass on a vanilla object rather than an anonymous class for Shame.define

make now supports overriding protected attributes.

(This used to work, but got broken in a code cleanup. There's now a spec.)

Gem version is now 0.1.6.
Updated the list of contributors in the README.
Update gem version to 0.1.5.
Allow id and type attributes in blueprints. (Thanks to Jon Guymon and Roland Swingler for pointing out the need for this, and providing equivalent patches.)

Rewrote the specs.

I was using the same couple of blueprints for all the specs, and they were starting to smell a lot like fixtures. That was somewhere between ironic and hypocritical, so now each spec defines its own blueprint.

Cleaned up perryn's patch to allow strings as keys to make, which helps machinist play nicely with Cucumber's FIT tables.

Gem version is now 0.1.4.
Merge branch 'master' of git://github.com/perryn/machinist into perryn
Added specs for accessing the object under construction and its attributes from within a blueprint.
allow string keys in parameters
allow strings as keys
Rolled the gem version up to 0.1.3.
Simplified Lathe#initialize after Clinton's changes.
Took the glob out of the gemspec, so github doesn't complain when building the gem.
Ditched all the echoe gem stuff, and hand-rolled a gemspec. Much less confusing.
Updated version number to make github rebuild the gem.

Merge branch 'master' of git://github.com/elight/machinist into elight/master

Brought in elight's fixes to make machinist work as a gem, and made them play nicely with my gemspec generation stuff.
Fixed a typo in the README. Thanks to Kyle Neath (http://github.com/kneath) for pointing it out.
Added the built gem to .gitignore.
Converted gem stuff to use echoee, and made it friendly with github's magic gem generation.
gemify
Moved the ActiveRecord extensions into their own model, to avoid polluting the ActiveRecord namespace any more than we need to.
Fixed up broken autotest depencies.
Added some credits to the README.
Fixed a minor error in the README.

Fixed bugs with blocks passed to make and make_unsaved.

Blocks passed to make now get called correctly, even inside a make_unsaved call.

Calls to make inside a block passed to make_unsaved will save the object.
Added make_unsaved method to allow constructing object graphs in memory.

Added a :unique option to Sham, to allow generating non-unique values.

This is based on code and discussion with Roland Swingler (http://github.com/knaveofdiamonds), so credit to him.
Rewrote Sham to be a bit neater, in preparation for adding some more options.
A few more clarifications.
A few more tweaks to the README.
Wrote a more comprehensive README.

You now how sometimes you write a couple of lines of code, and you're not happy with them, but you can't think of a nicer way, so you push them up to github, and only then do you work it out? Yeah, anyway.
make optionally takes a block, and passes in the created object. Suggested by technoweenie.

Make sure we don't reset the sequence returned by rand outside Sham.

Turns out Ruby's srand doesn't work the way you'd think. The seed value it returns is the initial value used to see the generator, not the current seed value. That means you can't use it to save and restore your spot in the sequence.
Added some rough docs for Sham, and got rid of the failed attempt to have Test::Unit automatically reset Sham before each test.
Simplified the Sham value generating code.
Made sure Sham couldn't get into an infinite loop generating values.
Added more Sham related things: resetting before each spec, index passed to sham blocks, autotest support.
Added first cut of Sham for generating repeatable random values for fields.
Got rid of the old README file. (Gotta remember that -a to git commit.)
Wrote some very basic docs.
More specs.
Added some basic specs.
Initial import.
